title: She was posing for her wedding photos, then an explosion hit
description: A photographer in Beirut was filming a bride on her wedding day when an explosion suddenly ripped through the city.

title: Late-night host mocks Trump's use of charts during Axios interview
description: Late-night hosts Seth Meyers and Jimmy Fallon took shots at President Donald Trump's defense of his coronavirus response during an interview with Axios on HBO.

title: Megan Rapinoe says 'we all have a responsibility to make the world a better place'
description: Megan Rapinoe has always been about goals, both the scoring and achieving of them.

title: One pilot brings the world to Iceland
description: Ancient tales of trolls and magic live on in Iceland, an island nation of volcanoes, lava fields, glaciers and ice caves.

title: HSBC bet the bank on China. It's in big trouble if tensions escalate
Trump's interview debacle sends a warning for the fall campaign
US obesity epidemic could undermine effectiveness of a Covid-19 vaccine
How 'gym rat' Brooks Koepka is bucking golf's trends
description: "He loves working out; He's a gym rat; He hits the ball a mile," are some of the ways Brooks Koepka has been characterized by a number of golf writers and commentators.

title: India's Narendra Modi lays foundation stone at divisive Ayodhya temple despite rise in coronavirus cases
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has laid a foundation stone for the construction of a Hindu temple at a holy site that's been at the center of the country's most politically and culturally divisive land dispute.

title: Tiger Woods confident of adding to major tally at PGA Championship
description: Asked if he could win the PGA Championship, golf's first major of the calendar year amid a disrupted season, a smiling Tiger Woods had a simple answer for reporters.

title: Ammonium nitrate stored in a warehouse linked to catastrophic blast that killed at least 100 people
description: A warehouse storing thousands of tons of unsecured highly explosive material has emerged as a possible source of the massive blast that ripped through the Lebanese capital on Tuesday, killing nearly 80 people, injuring 4,000 and sending a shock wave across the city that damaged buildings and blew out windows up to 10 kilometers (6 miles) away.

title: An event that brings thousands of tourists to a small South Dakota city is about to begin
description: Despite objections from a majority of its residents, a South Dakota city is preparing to host what some locals say is the largest gathering of motorcycle enthusiasts in the world.

title: What we know about the Beirut blast
description: A massive explosion rocked the Lebanese capital of Beirut on Tuesday evening, leaving dozens dead and thousands injured.

title: Satellite imagery reveals new penguin colonies in Antarctica
description: Satellite imaging has revealed that there are nearly 20% more emperor penguin colonies in Antarctica than previously thought.

title: Cyclone Isaias moves into Canada after killing 5 on US east coast
description: Isaias, now a post-tropical cyclone, has moved into southeastern Canada, bringing heavy rain and powerful winds over the province of Quebec.

title: A blast like no other: Beirut explosion felt like an earthquake
description: It's an earthquake, I thought, as the CNN bureau in central Beirut shook Tuesday with a violence I'd never felt before. I crouched down on the floor, waiting for more tremors.

title: CNN correspondent reports from wrecked bureau
description: A massive explosion ripped through central Beirut, Lebanon, injuring hundreds of people and blowing out windows in buildings across the city. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports from the damaged CNN bureau.

title: US officials contradict Trump: No indication yet of attack in Beirut
description: Three US Defense Department officials told CNN that as of Tuesday night there was no indication that the massive explosions that rocked Beirut on Tuesday were an "attack," contradicting an earlier claim from President Donald Trump.

title: US health chief to make most senior visit to Taiwan in decades
description: United States Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar will lead a delegation to Taiwan, his office announced Tuesday, in a high-level trip that is almost certain to anger Beijing, which claims the self-governing island as part of its territory.

title: Former Uber self-driving car exec sentenced to 18 months in prison
description: Anthony Levandowski, a former Uber executive who oversaw its self-driving vehicle efforts, pleaded guilty and was sentenced to 18 months in prison on Tuesday for stealing an internal tracking document from Google related to its self-driving car program.

title: Devastating aftermath of deadly blast in Beirut
description: A massive explosion ripped through central Beirut, killing dozens of people, injuring thousands and blowing out windows in buildings across the city. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

title: They broke into their own gym defying Covid-19 rules, hear why
description: New Jersey Atilis Gym owners Frank Trumbetti and Ian Smith defend opening their gym, defying Covid-19 safety restrictions put in place by the governor.

title: Inside Trump's TikTok reversal
NYC party boat owners arrested after their cruise was busted with more than 170 guests on board
description: A riverboat party attended by more than 170 people in New York over the weekend violated state and city emergency orders, according to the New York City Sheriff's Office.

title: Novavax Phase 1 data shows coronavirus vaccine is safe and elicits an immune response
description: A third US company has released study results showing its coronavirus vaccine is safe and elicits an immune response.

title: Covid-19 victim's husband explains why he took off his PPE in final moments
description: ICU Dr. Joseph Costa died after battling Covid-19. His husband, David Hart, remembers his emotional final moments as staff throughout the ICU gathered to say goodbye.

title: Explorer's mission to photograph a century of climate change in Patagonia
description: Chilean explorer and photographer, Cristian Donoso, has spent over two decades traversing the wilds of Patagonia, Antarctica and the Arctic to capture images showing the impacts of climate change.

title: Trump's claim leaves Anderson Cooper astonished
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper takes President Donald Trump to task for saying the 160,000 US coronavirus deaths "is what it is" and saying Covid-19 is under control.
